short_summary: Development and maintenance of the National Hydrographic Network
description: 1. Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)An ACAN is a public notice indicating to the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services, or construction to a pre-identified supplier, thereby allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding, by submitting a statement of capabilities. If no supplier submits a statement of capabilities that meets the requirements set out in the ACAN, on or before the closing date stated in the ACAN, the contracting officer may then proceed with the award to the pre-identified supplier.2. Definition of the requirementThe Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) has a requirement to: develop and maintain a national hydrographic / hydrospatial network. This is a geospatial product covering the extent of Canada with data that represents surface water features (i.e., lakes, rivers) and their connectivity. This network is critical for hydrologic and in many cases hydraulic modelling (i.e., flood inundation modelling, flood hazard mapping).The existing National Hydrographic Network (NHN; https://natural-resources.canada.ca/science-and-data/science-and-research/earth-sciences/geography/topographic-information/geobase-surface-water-program-geeau/national-hydrographic-network/21361).), a dataset produced and maintained by NRCan, is extremely deprecated in most regions of Canada, and in many ways is not suitable for analysis purposes (such as hydrologic / hydraulic modelling). The Canadian Hydrospatial Network (CHN) is being developed by NRCan to replace the NHN with new and improved features, connectivity, and associated attributes.The work will involve the following: automatically extracting high resolution hydrospatial network features (i.e., flowpaths, catchments, points of connection, surface water polygons for lakes and large rivers) from relatively recent, high resolution source data (i.e. digital elevation models – DEMs; aerial / satellite imagery). Features will need to be validated and connected into a network. Other attributes of the network, including but not limited to stream order, will also need to be automatically calculated with advanced tools.

full_summary:
### Development and Maintenance of the National Hydrographic Network
#### Tender Announcement
* **Reference Number**: PW-23-01029466
* **Solicitation Number**: NRCan-5000072532 (175867)
* **Publication Date**: 2023-03-08
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-03-23T14:00:00

**Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)**: 
The National Science Foundation of Canada (Natural Resources Canada) is issuing an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) to inform the supplier community that the department intends to award a contract for the development and maintenance of the National Hydrographic Network.

**Background**:
The Department of Natural Resources Canada has a requirement to develop and maintain a national hydrographic/hydrospatial network, covering the entire Canadian territory with data representing surface water features, such as lakes and rivers, and their connectivity.

**Scope of Work**:
The scope of work will include:

* Automating the extraction of hydrospatial network features from high-resolution data sources such as digital elevation models and aerial/satellite imagery.
* Validating and connecting extracted features into a network.
* Calculating additional network attributes, including stream order.

**Specific Tools Required**:
The contractor is required to provide two new open-source tools: 
1. A software tool to create a vector representation of outlets, confluences, and channel heads for a hydrologic network and assign useful hydrological attributes.
2. A software tool to repair topological errors in vector flow path data, including connecting dangling tributary vectors and joining vector arcs.

**Instructions to Suppliers**:
To submit a statement of capabilities, please address all requirements outlined in the ACAN to the contact person below. Only one supplier is considered capable of meeting the mandatory criteria and the department intends to enter into a contract with this supplier.

**Trade Agreements and Conditions**:
The procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement and other trade agreements outlined in the notice. The department may invoke an exception under the Regulations for the limitation of tendering or the Règlement sur les marchés de l'État.

**Contact Information**:
For any inquiries, please contact:
Brenda Harlow, Procurement Specialist, Natural Resources Canada
Brenda.Harlow@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca

Please see the attached document for full details. 

[NoticeURL].Pdf 

Note: Some technical terms have been simplified or reworded to improve clarity.
